results.title: Genre
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A day in the life of a blocked screenwriter. A film producer is harassing a screenwriter who is suffering major problems trying to come up with a script for his next movie. This short film visually depicts the film scenarios this writer conjures up - a mystery and gangster style thriller. Neither of these stories satisfy the frustrated screenwriter, and so he ends up writing a simple love story between two ordinary people. Finally he finishes the script and rushes to the post box to send his script to the producer. Upon arriving at the letter box, he meets the woman of his dreams. His screenwriting dreams become a reality.

results.title: Unwise and foolish creations of fancy
results.creator_credit: Sally McCutcheon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sally McCutcheon tells her story, threaded together by her two life-long passions, dancing and beading. Through determination, discipline and the support of her family, McCutcheon has managed to excel at both at different stages of her life.

results.title: Unself portrait
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This work is an experimental work/abstract narrative on the notion of self, or the lack of a self identity, as a human figure tries to understand who he is.

results.title: Princes Street Port Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Lyn McLeavy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A tribute to a suburb, a family and a lady who liked to play the piano and sing the blues. Lyn McLeavey describes growing up in Port Melbourne in the 1950s, blending in the harsh realities of life as the daughter of a traumatised ‘wharfie’, with the simple joy of the sounds of the streets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lyn McLeavy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Tumbleweeds
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An dramatic look at the trouble faced by a teenage couple. The girl finds out that she is pregnant and has decided to give it up for adoption. The boy still loves her and they must face making the final decision together.
